alert.note: Alert for Mainland Monroe (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Key West (Key West - The Florida Keys)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 27 at 3:22AM EDT until further notice by NWS Key West
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the Upper Keys in Monroe County and Middle Keys in Monroe County. * WHEN...Until 530 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 320 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Plantation Key, Lower Matecumbe Key, Craig Key and Tea Table Key. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Do not drive your vehicle into areas where the water covers the roadway. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely.
